args: Let me work here! I beseech you!
Er... Refresh my memory.\nWho're you, again?
Why, I am the Child of Miracles—\nshe whose hands will sculpt a world where\nhumans and dragons can live in harmony!
Aha! Now I remember. But, uh... Wasn't\nyour country trying to ERADICATE dragons?
In the past, yes. But I seek to change the\nperception that dragons are our enemies.
You need not concern yourself with my\ntitle or position right now, though.
Please just call me Amane—for you will\nbe my superior while I am working here.
You're really set on this, aren't you?\nWhy would someone of your station\nwant to work here, of all places?
Circumstances have led to my country\nadopting many a child-turned-orphan in\nthe wake of draconic conflict.
And I, seeing something of my own\nsordid past in their plight...

...suggested that we ought to give them
sweets to assuage their aching hearts.
My countrymen rebutted, arguing it to be
an unnecessary luxury.
Fie, I say. I know from my own experience\njust how much sweets can raise one's\nspirits in life's darkest hours.
Thus, I have come to earn the money\nI need to treat them to such pleasures.
I know exactly how much money I need—\nand I won't give up until I've earned it!
You've got determination in spades,\nif nothing else! How did the others\nback home react to the idea?
At first, they tried to stop me...but after\nwitnessing the intensity of my resolution,\nthey agreed to support my decision!
Well, you won't hear me complaining!
This is our busiest season of the year, and\nsince I can't magically sprout an extra pair\nof hands, you've come at the perfect time.
Gladly! I think I have a spare uniform\nthat's exactly your size, too.
Let me see if I can find it and make a few\ntweaks. If you're still on board after that,\nthe job's yours!
Hee hee. Well? Is it cute, or what?\nI think this design will really suit you!
I-I appreciate the bid of confidence, but...\nIsn't it a bit twee for a woman of 24?
I'm not opposed to cutesy aesthetics,\nbut I can't help but feel it's not very\nage-appropriate.
People can be cute at any age!\nAnd being cute gives a big morale boost,\nthereby improving customer satisfaction.
It's called ＂dressing for success,＂\nand I'm a huge proponent of it!
Hee hee. Glad to hear it!\nStarting today, this restaurant\nshall be known as the Kitty Cafe!
And you shall be its shining star—\nits meowning glory!
But pressure gives birth to brilliant\ndiamonds, and I shall shine bright!\nBusiness shall boom most miraculously!
Now that's what I like to hear!\nLet the success story...begin!
Can I get one of these?
Of course—but are you sure that's ALL\nyou want? Our skewers and fried fish\nare second to none!
Oh, uh... I'm actually not that hungry, so...
There's no need to be shy! I haven't even\ngotten started on how good our seafood\nsoup is, or our fresh salads and desserts...
You can't be excessively pushy with\ncustomers! You're going to drive them\naway!
*sigh* Can you go finish the soup in the\nkitchen instead? I'll handle taking orders.
The recipe is next to the pot. Got it?
I-I'm sorry... I will go and do just that.

Hm. I've never seen this dish before.
First I have to ＂strain＂ it—whatever that
means—and then add three teaspoons of
salt and some vinegar to spice it up.

I don't know how much the recipe means
by ＂some,＂ but I imagine that the vinegar
is the star ingredient here, so let's go wild!
Take this: Miraculous Vinegar Splash!
Oof. That's a pretty pungent aroma.
Amane! What IS that smell?\n...Oh no!
Argh! I've been slow-cooking that soup\nsince this morning! Here, let me fix it.
All right. But what should I do next?
Well, since you struck out in both the\ndining room and the kitchen, how about\nyou just wash those dishes for me?
Understood! Then, once they're clean,\nI'll dry them with my wind magic!
Er... I probably should've set the dial to\n＂spring breeze＂ rather than ＂cyclone.＂
Oh NO! Why are all the dishes broken?!
*sigh* Somehow, hiring you has actually\nmade MORE work for me around here.
I-I'm sorry to be such a nuisance...
I only wanted to help, but I'm liable to\ndrive the Kitty Cafe under at this rate.
Perhaps I was a fool to think I could\ndo anything for the children back home.
I won't deny that your ＂assistance＂ has\ndone more harm than good around here...
Ugh! Am I truly that bad at this?

I'm afraid I'd be better off asking an actual
cat to help out, opposable thumbs or not.
But you have what matters most of all—
the right mindset for the job.
You're trying to make people happy.
You may have stumbled...a LOT...but\nall your failures come from a genuine\nattempt to make everyone happy, right?
As long as you keep a positive attitude,\nthe rest will come in time. Don't give up!
Yes... Yes! I am the Child of Miracles,\nafter all! If anyone can do this, it's me!
I WILL make this cafe successful,\ncome what mew! ...Er, may!
That's the spirit! I'll have you up to speed\non both cooking and serving customers\nbefore the day is done. Let's get cracking!
